terra.shell.utils

Class JProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • terra.shell.utils.JProcess
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    _HibernateTimer, Command, InteractiveObject, TX

    public abstract class JProcess
extends java.lang.Object
    JProcess is a resource class which implements a Thread as its "heart". The JProcess controls this Thread and also controls the I/O of the Thread itself and contained code. A JProcess should be handled with care as the unexpected closure of one can deadlock JSH. JProcesses are extended by classes such as Command , Module. Terminal is a modified version of JProcess to prevent tampering with its code. All JProcesses should be managed using the JSHProcesses management class.
    Author:
    dan

        public JProcess()

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name, in text, of this process as specified by the process.
        Returns:
        The processes name.

      • start

        public abstract boolean start()
        Start the process.
        Returns:
        True if the process ended with no errors, otherwise false.

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Sends an interrupt to this process. The process will then take the interrupt as it sees fit. Use this before halt(), as this is simply to inform the thread within the process of its imminent disposal.

      • halt

        public void halt()
        Stops this process, if not otherwise changed this code will simply kill the process and clean up after it. This is not a guaranteed clean kill switch, and can cause deadlocks if the process is not properly informed of its disposal.

      • setUUID

        public final void setUUID(java.util.UUID u)
        Sets the UUID of this process, occurs at spawning of process and cannot be used to change the UUID later on.
        Parameters:
        u - New UUID to use as the processes UUID.

      • run

        public final boolean run()
        This method should invokes JProcesses start(); method.
        Returns:
        Invoke start();

      • run

        public final boolean run(boolean holdup)
        This should only be invoked by JProcesses start(); method
        Parameters:
        holdup - A parameter.
        Returns:
        Something useful for start();

      • getUUID

        public final java.util.UUID getUUID()
        Gives the UUID of this process, as generated at the processes spawning.
        Returns:
        The processes UUID.

      • setOutputStream

        public final void setOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream out)
        Change the OutputStream that this process will write to.
        Parameters:
        out - The new OutputStream to be written to.

      • getOutputStream

        public final java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
        Returns the OutputStream currently being written to by the process.
        Returns:
        The current OutputStream being written to.

      • redirectIn

        public final void redirectIn(java.io.InputStream s)
        Redirect this processes input, will create a new Scanner() object with this InputStream.
        Parameters:
        s - New InputStream to read from.

      • suspend

        public void suspend()
        Toggle whether or not to suspend this process. Suspension is passed to the code running in the process, and therefore is not guaranteed to occur.

      • isSuspended

        public boolean isSuspended()
